document.discussion_title: 68-48 - Guess you can't comeback and win 'em all, Rangers lose
document.topic_text:  Share Share on Facebook 55 Comments ⋆ Rec Recommend this Post 2 It was surface-of-the-sun hot in Arlington today and the Rangers and Rockies decided it was a good idea to play a game where they stand outside for over four hours today. The Rangers rallied, as they are wont to do, from deficits of 4-0, 6-3, and 7-5 to take a 9-7 lead heading into the top of the 8th before the Rockies did a Rangers on us and scored five runs in the inning to take a 12-9 lead that the Rangers eventually couldn't overcome. The Rangers won three games they maybe shouldn't have and lost a Lucas Harrell start. Meh. I'm shrugging and watching handball. Handball gif of the day: Player of the Game : Basically everyone but the people who threw the baseballs. Rougned Odor tripled, homered, and drove in three runs. Mitch Moreland went 3-for-4 with a home run. Adrian Beltre tied Cal Ripken Jr. for 47th all-time in homers with his 431th dong. Jurickson Profar had a couple of hits and a walk. Nomar Mazara had a couple of walks and a hit. And Ian Desmond looked ready to break out of his slump as he collected two hits, scored twice, and drove in a couple. Up Next : The Rangers try to get another winning streak started in the opener against the Tigers . Yu Darvish will take the mound against RHP Anibal Sanchez of Detroit. First pitch is scheduled for 7:05 pm CT.  Share Share on Facebook 55 Comments ⋆ Rec Recommend this Post 2 Latest News
